title: Emails going to All Mail
content: Suddenly a number of my emails are going directly to All Mail, by-passing the In Box. I haven't made any changes to settings
creator: Bryan1

title: MacOS Ventura update to MacOS Sonoma caused Thunderbird to stop working
content:
When I upgraded from MacOS Ventura to MacOS Sonoma, Thunderbird stopped working. Getting it to work the first time required me to use Apple's 2 Step Verification process to create an app-specific password. After the MacOS upgrade, that process was no longer available. Apple switched to 2 Factor Authentication, which is apparently different and incompatible with 2sv. The other websites and applications on my iMac have already switched to 2fa, and I'm not sure I can have both methods active on the same computer (but I've asked, Apple, anyway).

Is there a recent change in Thunderbird that would allow me to use 2fa instead of 2sv to access Thunderbird?

I have many years worth of emails in Thunderbird that I can no longer access. I can see the directory structure, and some of the email lists, but not the content.

Thanks for the help!
creator: rejohnston01

title: Command functions do not work T-bird 115
content: Using the new Thunderbird on Mac 10/3/2023. Command functions do not work. For example, the essential "Command 1" while Tbird is open only results in a beep, not an open window. The only way to open a window is to click on the icon in the Dock, or to quit and reopen the app. When open, none of the command functions are black in the drop-down menus - all gray.
creator: 19jamal

title: After Thunderbird upgrade to Supernova, clicking the "Mark as" button no longer toggles the status of the message
content:
After Thunderbird upgrade to Supernova on my Windows desktop, the "Mark as" button on the toolbar no longer toggles the status of the message. This was a really convenient feature.

Is there a way to get the "Mark as" button to work as it did before? If not, is there a way I can revert back to the pre-Supernova Thunderbird? It was a perfect program, but now with the change to the "Mark as" button and with the mouse scroll wheel no longer working (just in Supernova, works fine for everything else in Windows), seems like Thunderbird took steps backwards with Supernova.

title: After Thunderbird upgrade to Supernova, scroll wheel stopped working.  "Mark" message in toolbar works differently
content:
Right after upgrading Thunderbird to Supernova on my Windows desktop, the scroll wheel on my mouse stopped working. This is just within Thunderbird, the scroll wheel works fine for everything else in Windows.

Is there a fix? If not, is it possible I can revert back to Thunderbird pre-Supernova? This is really annoying, that one convenient feature missing knocks Thunderbird far down below other mail software.

Add to that the "Mark as" button on the toolbar no longer works as it did before. Used to be able to just click it to toggle the status of the message, a one-click method of marking a message as read or unread.

~Syn~

title: Recent update from MacOS Ventura to MacOS Sonoma cause access to Thunderbird to fail.
content:
Thunderbird was working under MacOS Ventura, and I do remember setting up 2 Step Verification to make that happen. Several other websites were later added, apparently using 2 Factor Authentication, instead. I followed the instructions to upgrade MacOS Ventura to MacOS Sonoma. Everything except Thunderbird continued to work correctly. I tried to use the "old" app specific password to get Thunderbird to work again, but that failed. Then I tried to find the MacOS tool under Sonoma to allow me to regenerate the app-specific password for Thunderbird, but it's no longer available (replaced by 2fa, I assume).

1. How do I restore 2sv support for Thunderbird under Sonoma? 2. Will it cause the newly installed 2fa apps to fail?

I have "lots" of stuff in my Thunderbird email repository that are no longer accessible via what remains of Thunderbird (basically, the directory structure). Please help me recover from this disaster.

Thanks!

creator: carolcottle2

title: Unified Trash Folder issues
content:
I have been having problems with deleted emails. The issue seems to be with unified trash folder. If you have the account checked in unified trash folder, the trash folder in that account disappears, so when you delete an email it goes to ??? If you uncheck the account in the unified trash folder properties, the trash folder reappears in the account and deleted emails will then go to that accounts trash folder.

So, you have to have 1 account in unified trash folder to save settings. As a work around I used an old account I no longer use and have it as the only account in the unified trash folder.

Trash in all other accounts now go to their individual trash folder and not the unified folder.

I hope this makes sense but it is the only way I could get deleted files to work.

Example:

  • Moved an e-mail to Folder 1
  • The list of e-mails that I'm looking at ... let's say from Oct 3rd, 2023 - Sept 29th, 2023 ... shifts. Now it is showing e-mails from Sept 26th, and I need to scroll up in order to view the e-mails I was looking at
  • Basically, all this means is that each time I move an invoice, I have to scroll up to look at the current group of e-mails I was looking at which is inconvenient and did not happen previously

creator: Raoul_Drapeau

title: Please keep the option of a separate mail toolbar as this new design breaks consistency with most linux programs..
content:
Can there please be an option to un-unify the dynamic toolbar? Attached are two screen shots. The first shows the top of a myriad of linux applications. The second attachment show the former version of thunderbird.

All share a common theme. At the top is what I think is called the system bar with the min/max/close icons at the right, the title in the center, and the hamburger icon for a menu of system options on the left. Below that is what I think is called the menu bar which in most cases contains submenus like "File", "Edit", etc. Further more there is a coomon design theme where in my theme selection, has the system and menu bars in different colors. For the active window, the system bar is in color and for the other it is darker than the menu bar.

A consistent style across most applications. To a great extent, the system bar is for top-level system options, not the application. Consistency is good. Consistency is efficient.

The latest version of thunderbird breaks that consistency, in a variety of ways. Some people might like the new look, but if you are going to break the consistency of design, at least give users the option of restore the consistent style. Have a option to leave the system bar as it was, have a separate "mail toolbar" under the menu toolbar as it used to be, and use the standard colorization of the various toolbars so the only one which is colored is the system toolbar.

Thank you.
creator: product

title: Bugs and problems with Thunderbird
content:
Bugs and problems with Thunderbird

Thunderbird crashes by random. White sending e-mail, just leaving the program running at some point, saving a concept e-mail. I don't see any (error) message. Or any form of reason is given. This bug is still not solved.

As same bug and problem with Firefox, Thunderbird doesn't update. Menu Help --> About Thunderbird, show the version Thunderbird 115.2.0 (64-bits) - No new update information does appear here. - See a spinning circle, become stuck in download or install mode. - Need restart Thunderbird to apply the update, then *same* updates needs to be installed or downloaded, keep stuck here and this message. The only way is do the update manually and go tho the website.

  • Don't use the installer*, but always the setup. Which contains the full package and can finish the update installation.

This bug appeared already in earliest versions of Thunderbird and Firefox.

Why I cannot save concept e-mails? Which should be saved locally on my hard drive. But, it seems I need an internet connection to do this. For this one, the SMTP settings do not match (error) message can appear many times. Saving that e-mail on another e-mail address can work, if waiting and trying later doesn't solve this.


Icon from Thunderbird was changed to stranger looking one. Now there's a lighter blue bird is lying, surrounding a pearl. Instead of a darker blue bird with the wings around the envelop. Original and better being known icon: https://assets-prod.sumo.prod.webservices.mozgcp.net/media/uploads/products/2020-04-14-08-47-12-0d1c59_1.png


Several folders do appear multiple times. Like having a Spam and Junk folder for same e-mail account. Folder name can a little bit different. It seems not possible to delete all these folders, or just one of them.

Thunderbird seems to respond slower, it take more time. Switching from Thunderbird to Firefox, gives white or black empty windows, or smal parts are still visible. Same for switching from Firefox to Thunderbird. Same with Notepad. Trying to select a piece of text. Other opened folder and windows.

Missing e-mail messages and get no answers on my e-mail messages I did send. Can send e-mail messages to several others with my ISP given e-mail addresses, but some of them seems to can send an answer back, while they saying they did. - Do they really send the e-mail message? - Also, are they using my good e-mail address? Already added confirm and delivery notices to it, but this seems to do nothing. When I add my own e-mail to this e-mail message, this one will arrive fast. New e-mail messages to them as the less received answer e-mail messages from them. Same ISP e-mail addresses are used.


Sending e-mail messages, even new, with just text, a few words or lines take longer time. A loading bar appears and gets filled with large lines. Unknown why this happen. It seems useless, as the loading bar will fast disappear. Sometimes it can be longer and showing some message about no connection, which is also stupid.


While sending e-mail Thunderbird gives following (error) messages: -Server is busy. -SMTP-settings do not match. Random and return. Strange, when sending an e-mail test message, this one will arrive. Same as e-mail message before and later. It seems the server forgets SMTP-settings and connection. -Other less known and stupid (error) messages.

For unknown reasons, I cannot send some e-mail messages. Wait and try later doesn't work. I see a strange, useless (error) message, who doesn't help with this problem. Why let it send my e-mail? This is stupid.


Same e-mail appears multiple times in my e-mail accounts from same sender and with same subject.


E-mail settings are good, otherwise I could not send e-mail messages, at that current time or later. Is Thunderbird forgetting something, using wrong settings or this happen due bugs in version 100x and newer.

Other bugs and problems happen after an "update" was installed. From not able to start Thunderbird anymore, seeing strange and useless error messages to empty e-mail.

Now, Thunderbird crashed without any reason and showing an (error) message, didn't save my e-mail messages and they don't appear in the Send or Concept folders. Thank you, every e-mail message who I was still making, are now gone. This is very annoying and stupid!



I'm using Thunderbird version 115.2.0 (64-bits) on Windows 64-bits and cable internet connection.

creator: larab1

title: Blank message display tabs when opening inbox and sent mails
content:
I recently noticed that Thunderbird quietly updated itself from 102.15.1 to 115.3.1 for me today. (I'm on Win 10)

After this, none of the emails in my imap.gmail.com mail account are viewable: My 'Inbox' shows 2 email accounts underneath and selecting the gmail one shows a big list of messages but opening (double-clicking) any of them just opens a new tab that remains entirely empty.

Emails for the other Inbox account do correctly show messages in a new tab when opening, as things were previously.

The Tools > Developer Tools > Error Console shows the following errors (after having first cleared the log and then restarted Tb) - NotFoundError: No such JSWindowActor 'DevToolsFrame' Assert failed: Calendar manager initialised calendars before loadCalendarComponent ran on the first 3pane window. This should not happen. 

calUtils.jsm:127:15

NotFoundError: No such JSWindowActor 'DevToolsFrame'

I found recent posts for similar sounding issues (but not quite the same). One suggested deleting 'folderCache.json', 'session.json', and 'xulstore.json' files from my thunderbird profile folder and restarting. I tried and it had no noticeable effect.

I can't be sure whether it was there before but after the problem update, I notice I have 2 instances of my gmail address showing under the 'Sent' tray/group. Under sent it lists 2 x my gmail.com account and my other account. Again, the other account's sent mails can be viewed just fine as before but the first '...@gmail.com' account list most (perhaps all) of my sent emails, but opening any of them just brings up a totally blank new tab again.

Interestingly, however, the other (new?) duplicate '...@gmail.com' under the Sent group also shows a big list of sent emails and this one does correctly show all messages when viewing any in a new tab. The properties of both of these identical-looking 'sent' mailboxes ('x'-ing out my email) are - 1st - Location: imap://xxxxxxxxx%40gmail.com@imap.gmail.com/Sent Showing 267 sent messages Doesn't work. Viewing any of the messages just shows a blank tab. 2nd - Location: imap://xxxxxxxxx%40gmail.com@imap.gmail.com/%5BGmail%5D/Sent%20Mail Showing 283 sent messages Works. Viewing any of these opens a tab that correctly shows the message. To my knowledge, I've not added the second almost identical 'sent' gmail account.

The location of the newly broken @gmail.com Inbox is - Location: imap://xxxxxxxxxx%40gmail.com@imap.gmail.com/INBOX

The fact that one of the gmail.com sent lists/view works and the other doesn't suggests something might be wrong with the 1st 'location' format. I've not touched either for as long as I can remember. Could the upgrade have diddled the 'location' in such a way as to cause this behaviour or also duplicated a subtly different gmail.com 'Sent' folder?

The main Tools > Account Settings does not appear to have a field that directly specified any of the 'Inbox' or 'Sent' Location fields that I can see; it just list my 2 email accounts, with my now broken gmail.com one listed first, with server settings - - Type: IMAP mail server - Server Name: imap.gmail.com - User Name: xxxxxxxxxx@gmail.com - Port: 993 - Connection security: SSL/TLS - Authentication method: OAuth2

Can anyone explain where the subtly different 'Sent' gmail entries might have come from and whether either of the 'Location' fields look invalid? Also, since my gmail Inbox 'Location' looks to have a similar format of that of the broken 'Sent' item/folder, does anyone know whether it is invalid and can be fixed with a different location field?
creator: Ernie_Gurney

title: Disappointing release, Thunderbird Team
content:
Thunderbird Team,

The 115.3.1 release is a real disappointment.

1) I have three accounts in Thunderbird. The subfolders for my three accounts now make no sense. Inbox - has my three accounts, as expected. Drafts - has my three accounts, as expected. Sent - has my three accounts, as expected. Trash - folder now empty. Used to have my three accounts. Now they are under each account's folder Junk - has only two of my three accounts. The third junk folder is labeled 'spam' and is under my Gmail account.

2) When I got a couple of messages just now, they were duplicated (only in Thunderbird, not on any other of my clients). Deleting one of the duplicates wound up deleting both of them and replacing them with a null message dated January 1, 1970. I moved the deleted message from the Trash folder back to the Inbox, resulting in the correct single message.

3) My 2020 Archive folder is no longer under Archives > Local Folders. It is now under the Local Folders account. All the other Archive folders are where they used to be.

4) When I switch to Inbox - sometimes it scrolls to the top, not to where I was, and not to bottom where the most recent messages are. I cannot figure out how to reproduce this.

5) The default density for viewing emails does not correspond to what I used to have. It is unfortunate to not keep the previous default.

I don't dare reverting to the prior release because I have no confidence that doing so will restore my folder configuration. I fear I might even lose data. I know you worked hard on this release, but this user is not happy with the folder bugs and user interface changes.

Tim
creator: tim263

content:

How can I fix this, or how can I downgrade to the last version?

title: "Neues" Thunderbird
content:
Ich benutze Thunderbird schon seit Jahren, aber das letzte Update ist so Benutzerunfreundlich das ich den Wunsch habe ein anderes Programm zu nutzen!!!!!! Was nützen mir hundert verschiedene Möglichkeiten Menüleisten zu wählen, wenn das WICHTIGSTE – das Emailfeld zum lesen wird in der größe derart beschnitten wird das man nur noch hin und her scrollen muss???? Das Feld für "erhaltene mails" läßt sich nicht mehr weit genug reduzieren!! Auf diese Art wird dann ungefähr ein Drittel des Bildschirms mit unnötigen Menüleisten und einer nicht mehr einstellbaren mail Vorschau verschwendet!!! In meinen Augen kein Fortschritt, sondern eher ein Rückschritt!!!!!!!!!!! Macht was, oder ihr habt mich als nutzer verloren. Oder gibt es „versteckte" Einstellungen die diesen schwachsinn neutralisieren??

I've been using Thunderbird for years, but the latest update is so user-unfriendly that I have the desire to use another program!!!!!! What good are a hundred different ways to choose menu bars if the MOST IMPORTANT - the email field for reading is cut in size so that you only have to scroll back and forth???? The field for "received mails" can no longer be reduced far enough!!! In this way about a third of the screen is wasted with unnecessary menu bars and a no longer adjustable mail preview!!! In my eyes no progress, but rather a step backwards!!!!!!!!!!! Do something or you have lost me as a user. Or are there "hidden" settings that neutralize this bullshit???
creator: f.hellberg

title: Transfer 400k email from 3 gmail accounts to 1 new account
content:
I have setup thunderbird to transfer 3 accounts emails to one new one in thunderbird but have run into some issues. It is roughly 400k emails across all accounts.

IMAP is turned on in all the accounts. I have tried going to one accounts "All Mail" and selecting all and right clicking on that selection to copy them all to "All Mail" on the new account - I get a message that it is downloading all these emails again ( in the bottom left corner) though I don't see any emails show up in that new folder. When I try a single email copy it doesn't show up there either.

I believe I am missing some sort of functionally ( IMAP or otherwise) that belies the UX instruction to copy an email from one folder to another.

Also I tried setting up a local folder and doing the same, and no luck there either.

In some instances I was able to get maybe 100 emails to move from one all mail to another though It was me trying this over and over and sometimes the number of total email would change to the right of "all mail"

Ultimately I want to download all my email locally, copy all these local emails to the local sync path for my new email account and hopefully have those sync up to Gmail via thunderbird. Do I have this process misunderstood, are there limitations and how would this be possible through other means if what I describe is incorrect?

the new gmail is setup to have the storage needed for these emails as well.

title: Problema TLS con Thunderbird dopo trasferimento profilo - SOLUZIONE
content:
Ho trasferito il profilo di Thunderbird da un vecchio PC con Windows 7 ad un nuovo PC con Windows 11.

Tutto OK riguardo i vari account di posta che ho regolarmente ritrovato, ma stranamento non scaricava la posta di nessuna casaella (domini aziendali, pec e gmail), con questo messaggio di errore:

"Si è verificato un errore TLS che non può essere ignorato. Si tratta di un errore di Handshake o probabilmente la versione TLS o il certificato usato dal server xxxxx non sono compatibili"

Ho trovato una risposta su questo sito che suggeriva di abbassare il livello minimo del TLS da 3 a 1 (da TLS 1.2 a TLS 1.0), ma nonostante anche un riavvio, il problema è rimasto.

Inoltre è abbastanza strano che caselle delle PEC ma anche la GMAIL utilizzino ancora un TLS vecchio e insicuro.

Ho rimesso i parametri come prima e ho creato un nuovo profilo e configurato una nuova casella di posta, inserendo i parametri corretti di imap e smpt. Compare la richiesta per l'eccezione del certificato.

OK è la mail del dominio ma sono sicuro che il certificato è valido, un semplice Let's Encrypt, ma valido. Vado a vedere il certificato... E compaiono varie informazioni di ESET, ovvero l'antivirus installato nel PC (Endpoint Security).

Ho risolto andando in Configurazione -> Protezioni -> SSL/TLS e disattivando la voce "Blocca traffico crittografato da una versione obsoleta di SSL2"

Thunderbird ha ripreso a scaricare la posta

La cosa strana è che lo stesso Antivirus è installato in moltissimi altri computer che usando Thunderbird, con quella funzione regolarmente attiva.

title: Supernova - 115 - High CPU - trashing disk
content:
I noticed that the upgrade probably triggered a re-indexation of all emails. This is causing high CPU usage AND disk activity. The process is trashing the disk with small IOs. (As seen with procmon. Lots of writes to global-message-db-sqlite and global-message-db-sqlite-journal)

This is a problem for VDI environnement and shared storage. Not everyone has its own 8 cores, 1TB superfast NVMe SSD disk.

There is room for improvement here. I think.

title: Folders disappeared - years of email archives - please help!
content:
I'm using TB 102.15.1 on Mac

I use TB for work. I have (or had) folders where I keep archives of all work-related emails for all of my clients. I had one folder for each of my clients. After I read emails in my inbox, I move them to the relevant client folder to archive them. These folders have email archives going back for several years.

Just now I was reading emails in my inbox, then moving them to folders for archival, by dragging and dropping them into the relevant client folder. I had just finished reading an email and was about to drag/drop it into a folder for archival, and the folders were gone. There was a top-level folder called "Active Projects". There were sub-folders within the "Active Projects" folder - one for each client.

Not ALL folders have disappeared. Only the Active Projects folder has disappeared.

But,... I alt-clicked on an email in my inbox to get the pop-up window with a bunch of options for things to do with the email. I could select Move To -> Recent -> and the nested window that shows recent folders pops up, and it shows the client folders and I can (apparently) move emails to the client folders. But I can't see the folders.

Please help! This is years of work history. Any suggestions for how to get the Active Project folder and all of my client sub-folders to reappear?

creator: nickrestiv

title: TB 115.3.1 can not filter mail to folders
content:
TB 32 bit started complaining about not being able to write to folders. After a lot of reading I discovered that there is a hard 4Gbyte limit on each account. Started moving e-mails to folders under Local Folders but the problem remained; apparently the contents of Local Folders count toward the limit. Some suggested going to the 64 bit version, alleging that it had no such hard limit, which I did, but it shows the same behavior.

This the error message that repeatedly comes up: 

"Unable to write the email to the mailbox. Make sure the file system allows you write privileges, and you have enough disk space to copy the mailbox."

This a single user 64 machine running Windows 10 Pro 22H2 (OS Build 19045.3448). The file system allows me to do just about anything to it, and there are currently 592 GBytes free. That's after I made a 7.1Gbyte copy of my profile folder.

Currently the offending account is a gmail account. Google says there is about 10Gbyte available. Is this something that can be fixed easily, without abandoning my admittedly large backlog of e-mail? Is there possibly some flag set in my profile that invokes the 4GByte limit?

Thanks for any insight you can provide.
creator: david.kassover

creator: bessemer

title: Deleting from Trash Folder
content:
Most of my mail comes to me via gmail, in pop3 mode. I use the portable version available on Portable Apps and I keep the program updated regularly to the latest version. My habit is to keep six months of trash stored on my hard drive. Each month, I delete the earliest month from the trash folder, then I compact the folder to recover the space. This used to be easy, but after the recent changes in the interface it has become much more difficult.

Nowadays, it has become very difficult to select several hundred early trash messages at a time. Control-down does not scroll down smoothly any more to select a large number of highlighted messages for deletion. I have to do it in very small batches. I can manage this but it is time-consuming. When I have selected a block of messages, I press the delete button, and I get the cautionary warning that the deletions will be permanent. But there is no way to answer in the affirmative. Also the "don't ask me again" box does not respond to my mouse click, even though I don't really care whether I am asked again or not. There is no way to use that little interface to actually delete the files. It's a dead end.

After some experimentation, I discovered that I can use the "move to" on the right click menu to select "move to trash" even though I really want to delete them from the trash. Then I can compact the trash folder and recover the space. So I can still accomplish the deletion in a roundabout time-consuming way.

It would be nice if TB could make that feature easier to use, or if I am doing it wrong, at least inform me of an easier way to use it.
creator: pjmorton
